{"step_by_step_thinking": "Malignant hyperpyrexia is a condition that can be triggered by certain anesthetic agents. According to Document [0], the exact cause is unknown but it is suspected that triggering agents that release calcium from the calcium-storing sarcoplasmic membrane of the muscle cell are involved. Document [15] mentions that this condition can be triggered by certain volatile anaesthetic agents or Suxamethonium.
